item.title: Analysis: Electricity prices are surging, opening up a new line of attacks against Republicans
Even before Alaska summit, Putin is redrawing global order to his liking
Electricity prices are surging, opening up a new line of attacks against Republicans
item.description: The Washington Post’s essential guide to power and influence in D.C. In today’s edition: The political ramifications of surging electricity prices.

item.title: For Texas Democrats, fleeing to fight redistricting comes at a personal cost
item.description: The lawmakers have faced bomb threats, separation from their families and loss of income — as Republicans threaten another special session to push red...

item.title: Putin and Trump have met before. Here’s how those encounters went.
item.description: It will mark the first time the two leaders will meet in person since Russia invaded Ukraine in 2022. Here’s how their other meetings went.
